verses.esv: 26 Look at the birds of the air: they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?
verses.kjv: 26 Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
verses.niv: 26 Look at the birds of the air; they do not sow or reap or store away in barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not much more valuable than they?

verses.esv: 6 “If you come across a bird’s nest in any tree or on the ground, with young ones or eggs and the mother sitting on the young or on the eggs, you shall not take the mother with the young. 7 You shall let the mother go, but the young you may take for yourself, that it may go well with you, and that you may live long.
verses.kjv: 6 If a bird’s nest chance to be before thee in the way in any tree, or on the ground, whether they be young ones, or eggs, and the dam sitting upon the young, or upon the eggs, thou shalt not take the dam with the young: 7 But thou shalt in any wise let the dam go, and take the young to thee; that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days.
verses.niv: 6 If you come across a bird's nest beside the road, either in a tree or on the ground, and the mother is sitting on the young or on the eggs, do not take the mother with the young. 7 You may take the young, but be sure to let the mother go, so that it may go well with you and you may have a long life.

verses.esv: 20 And God said, “Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth across the expanse of the heavens.”
verses.kjv: 20 And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.
verses.niv: 20 And God said, "Let the water teem with living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth across the expanse of the sky."

verses.esv: 29 Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? And not one of them will fall to the ground apart from your Father.
verses.kjv: 29 Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.
verses.niv: 29 Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground apart from the will of your Father.

verses.esv: 30 And to every beast of the earth and to every bird of the heavens and to everything that creeps on the earth, everything that has the breath of life, I have given every green plant for food.” And it was so.
verses.kjv: 30 And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.
verses.niv: 30 And to all the beasts of the earth and all the birds of the air and all the creatures that move on the ground-everything that has the breath of life in it-I give every green plant for food." And it was so.

verses.esv: 26 Then God said, “Let us make man in our image, after our likeness. And let them have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the heavens and over the livestock and over all the earth and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth.”
verses.kjv: 26 And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
verses.niv: 26 Then God said, "Let us make man in our image, in our likeness, and let them rule over the fish of the sea and the birds of the air, over the livestock, over all the earth, and over all the creatures that move along the ground."

verses.esv: 32 It is the smallest of all seeds, but when it has grown it is larger than all the garden plants and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and make nests in its branches.”
verses.kjv: 32 Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.
verses.niv: 32 Though it is the smallest of all your seeds, yet when it grows, it is the largest of garden plants and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and perch in its branches."

verses.esv:
31   but they who wait for the LORD shall renew their strength;
    they shall mount up with wings like eagles;
  they shall run and not be weary;
    they shall walk and not faint.
verses.kjv: 31 But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.niv: 31 but those who hope in the LORD will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.

verses.esv: 21 So God created the great sea creatures and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarm, according to their kinds, and every winged bird according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
verses.kjv: 21 And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
verses.niv: 21 So God created the great creatures of the sea and every living and moving thing with which the water teems, according to their kinds, and every winged bird according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.

verses.esv: 24 Consider the ravens: they neither sow nor reap, they have neither storehouse nor barn, and yet God feeds them. Of how much more value are you than the birds!
verses.kjv: 24 Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?
verses.niv: 24 Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn; yet God feeds them. And how much more valuable you are than birds!

verses.esv:
12   Beside them the birds of the heavens dwell;
    they sing among the branches.
verses.kjv: 12 By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, which sing among the branches.
verses.niv: 12 The birds of the air nest by the waters; they sing among the branches.

verses.esv:
11   I know all the birds of the hills,
    and all that moves in the field is mine.
verses.kjv: 11 I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.
verses.niv: 11 I know every bird in the mountains, and the creatures of the field are mine.

verses.esv:
41   Who provides for the raven its prey,
    when its young ones cry to God for help,
    and wander about for lack of food?
verses.kjv: 41 Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
verses.niv: 41 Who provides food for the raven when its young cry out to God and wander about for lack of food?

verses.esv:
8   Like a bird that strays from its nest
    is a man who strays from his home.
verses.kjv: 8 As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.
verses.niv: 8 Like a bird that strays from its nest is a man who strays from his home.

verses.esv: 16 “Behold, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves, so be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.
verses.kjv: 16 Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.
verses.niv: 16 I am sending you out like sheep among wolves. Therefore be as shrewd as snakes and as innocent as doves.

verses.esv: 20 And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”
verses.kjv: 20 And Jesus saith unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.
verses.niv: 20 Jesus replied, "Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head."

verses.esv:
11   Ephraim’s glory shall fly away like a bird—
    no birth, no pregnancy, no conception!
verses.kjv: 11 As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird, from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.
verses.niv: 11 Ephraim's glory will fly away like a bird- no birth, no pregnancy, no conception.

verses.esv:
9   He gives to the beasts their food,
    and to the young ravens that cry.
verses.kjv: 9 He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.
verses.niv: 9 He provides food for the cattle and for the young ravens when they call.

verses.esv:
7   “But ask the beasts, and they will teach you;
    the birds of the heavens, and they will tell you;
8   or the bushes of the earth, and they will teach you;
    and the fish of the sea will declare to you.
9   Who among all these does not know
    that the hand of the LORD has done this?
10   In his hand is the life of every living thing
    and the breath of all mankind.
verses.kjv: 7 But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee: 8 Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee. 9 Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this? 10 In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.
verses.niv: 7 "But ask the animals, and they will teach you, or the birds of the air, and they will tell you; 8 or speak to the earth, and it will teach you, or let the fish of the sea inform you. 9 Which of all these does not know that the hand of the LORD has done this? 10 In his hand is the life of every creature and the breath of all mankind.

verses.esv:
2 And he called out with a mighty voice,

  “Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great!
    She has become a dwelling place for demons,
  a haunt for every unclean spirit,
    a haunt for every unclean bird,
    a haunt for every unclean and detestable beast.
verses.kjv: 2 And he cried mightily with a strong voice, saying, Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and is become the habitation of devils, and the hold of every foul spirit, and a cage of every unclean and hateful bird.
verses.niv: 2 With a mighty voice he shouted: "Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the Great! She has become a home for demons and a haunt for every evil spirit, a haunt for every unclean and detestable bird.

verses.esv: 4 And as he sowed, some seeds fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured them.
verses.kjv: 4 And when he sowed, some seeds fell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up:
verses.niv: 4 As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.

verses.esv:
7   Even the stork in the heavens
    knows her times,
  and the turtledove, swallow, and crane
    keep the time of their coming,
  but my people know not
    the rules of the LORD.
verses.kjv: 7 Yea, the stork in the heaven knoweth her appointed times; and the turtle and the crane and the swallow observe the time of their coming; but my people know not the judgment of the LORD.
verses.niv: 7 Even the stork in the sky knows her appointed seasons, and the dove, the swift and the thrush observe the time of their migration. But my people do not know the requirements of the LORD.

verses.esv:
27   Like a cage full of birds,
    their houses are full of deceit;
  therefore they have become great and rich;
verses.kjv: 27 As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and waxen rich.
verses.niv: 27 Like cages full of birds, their houses are full of deceit; they have become rich and powerful

verses.esv: 13 “And these you shall detest among the birds; they shall not be eaten; they are detestable: the eagle, the bearded vulture, the black vulture,
verses.kjv: 13 And these are they which ye shall have in abomination among the fowls; they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,
verses.niv: 13 "'These are the birds you are to detest and not eat because they are detestable: the eagle, the vulture, the black vulture,

verses.esv: 11 And when birds of prey came down on the carcasses, Abram drove them away.
verses.kjv: 11 And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.
verses.niv: 11 Then birds of prey came down on the carcasses, but Abram drove them away.
